app.name: Click Extra
app.one_liner: A drop-in replacement for Click to make user-friendly and colorful CLI applications with minimal boilerplate.

core_loop: Users define CLI commands using Click Extra decorators, which automatically apply consistent styling, configuration loading, help formatting, and cross-platform compatibility, reducing the need for repetitive setup code.

screens.name: CLI Help Screen
screens.purpose: Display formatted, colorful help output for the CLI application with aligned tables and proper ANSI rendering.

rust_commands.name: disable_config_auto_load
rust_commands.purpose: Allow users to opt out of automatic configuration file loading at runtime.

mvp_plan: week 1: Implement core Click wrapper with default colorization and help formatting
week 1: Add support for aligned table output without borders
week 1: Integrate configuration auto-loading with disable option
acceptance_tests: CLI renders help screen with proper ANSI colors and alignment in terminal
Configuration files are not loaded when auto-load is disabled via command flag
Table output uses single-space column separators and no borders in 'aligned' format
GitHub-style table format correctly renders alignment hints (:---, :---:, ---:)
open_questions: How to handle backward compatibility with older Click versions?
Should TOML/JSON/YAML config support be extended beyond current scope?
